articles.author: Jonatas Sas
articles.description:
Before we dive in, it's worth noting a recent branding change: the assistant formerly known as Codeium is now called Windsurf. The rebranding aims to reposition the tool under a new identity, though the transition has caused some confusion in the community, particularly among terminal-centric users. For clarity, throughout this article, we will refer to the tool as Windsurf, its current official name.
Among terminal enthusiasts, NeoVim has established itself as a powerhouse of productivity. Combining lightness, extensibility, and full control over the development environment, it's become the go-to editor for developers who not only write code but carefully curate a streamlined workflow. In this context, the integration of artificial intelligence tools for real-time code suggestions‚Äîcommonl‚Ä¶
articles.title: Inline AI Suggestions in NeoVim: GitHub Copilot vs Windsurf (Codeium) ‚Äî A Technical Comparative Analysis

articles.author: Jesus Hall
articles.description:
description: "Explore how IoT technology is transforming public bathroom cleaning with real-time monitoring and automation. Includes code examples and links to related cleaning services."
Public bathrooms are essential to urban infrastructure, yet maintaining their cleanliness remains a challenge in densely populated areas. Fortunately, with the rise of the Internet of Things (IoT), smart solutions are making it easier to monitor and maintain hygiene in public restrooms.
In this article, we explore how IoT sensors can be leveraged for real-time bathroom monitoring and automation. We'll walk through some practical use cases, technical implementations, and even share code snippets to illustrate the concepts. Whether you're a facility manager, developer, or just curious about smart sanitation‚Ä¶
articles.title: IoT Solutions for Automated Public Restroom Cleaning

articles.author: Dib Borah
articles.description:
Trash to Treasure: Boost Your Income with Unconventional Revenue Hacks!


In today's dynamic economy, almost everyone is looking for ways to increase their income without significantly disrupting their lives. Conventional strategies like a side hustle or investing in stocks might seem daunting to some. But what if I told you there are unconventional revenue hacks involving "trash" that could turn mundane tasks into profitable ventures? Let's dive into the world of converting what we often discard into cold, hard cash.
Did you know that aluminum cans are virtually 100% recyclable? In many places, you can earn cash by collecting and returning cans and bottles. The California Refund Value (CRV), for example, pays individuals to recycle specific containers. Here's how you can start:
Collect Ca‚Ä¶
articles.title: "Trash to Treasure: Boost Your Income with Unconventional Revenue Hacks!"

articles.author: Generatecode
articles.description:
Introduction
If you're looking to efficiently train your Spamassassin setup using the sa-learn command while taking advantage of your system's 12 vCPUs, you're definitely on the right track! In this article, we'll explore how you can feed multiple email files to Spamassassin in parallel using GNU Parallel, and address concerns about database access given your use of MariaDB.
Understanding the sa-learn Command
The sa-learn command is a vital part of Spamassassin's operation, allowing you to teach the spam filter about various spam and ham (non-spam) emails. In your case, you want to classify multiple emails quickly and efficiently using the command:
sa-learn -L --spam

This command marks the input emails as spam, which is crucial for training the spam filter to better identify unwanted mess‚Ä¶
articles.title: Can I Use GNU Parallel with Spamassassin's sa-learn Safely?

articles.author: INDHU MEENA
articles.description:
üöÄ Getting Started with Angular: What I Wish I Knew as a Beginner


When I first started learning Angular, I was overwhelmed by the structure, syntax, and all the moving parts ‚Äî modules, components, services... it felt like a lot.
After building my first real Angular project, things started to click. In this post, I‚Äôll walk you through the key concepts I learned (and the mistakes I made), so your journey with Angular can be smoother and faster than mine.
Angular apps are structured around a few key elements:
Components ‚Äì Control views. Each includes:
a template (HTML)
a class (TypeScript)
optional styles (CSS)
Modules ‚Äì Group related components and functionality.



Services ‚Äì Share logic or data across components using dependency injection.




üìå Beginner Tip: Don‚Äôt try to learn everythi‚Ä¶
articles.title: Getting Started with Angular: What I Wish I Knew as a Beginner

Resources:

articles.title: Orchestrating Workflows with AWS Step Functions and AWS SAM

articles.author: Jaskaran Deogan
articles.description:
Look, I get it. When I started out 3 years ago, I was all about getting my apps online the quickest way possible. Vercel for my Next.js projects, Netlify for static sites, and PM2 to keep my Node.js apps running on that cheap VPS I rented. It worked... until it didn't.
If you're like me, I highly encourage you to explore about Docker.
I thought I had it all figured out:
The One-Click Wonder: Push to GitHub, automatic deployment to a hosting platform. Magic! Until I needed custom environment configurations or hit the free tier limits.


The PM2 Savior: SSH into my server, git pull, npm install, pm2 restart. Simple enough... except when dependencies broke, or node versions mismatched, or any of the other thousand things that could go wrong.


The "It's Working, Don't Touch It" Server: That U‚Ä¶
articles.title: What is Docker and Why Should You Care?

articles.author: Andrey Karchevsky
articles.description:
A few months ago, I started wondering: ‚ÄúHow should we actually test database migrations?‚Äù
(Yes, that thing no one really does.)
Well ‚Äî sometimes people do test them, to be fair. The standard approach usually involves writing integration tests and checking how the application behaves with the new schema version.
But honestly, that‚Äôs not nearly enough to ensure the migration itself is correct.
A lot can go wrong:
ALTER TABLE suddenly takes an EXCLUSIVE ACCESS lock and production freezes until it‚Äôs done.


An index works on your local machine ‚Äî but silently fails on prod.


A migration wipes out data (someone forgot to delete a DROP TABLE used for debugging), and the last dump was from the Mesozoic era.


‚Ä¶
There are many hypothetical issues like this ‚Äî enough material for several talks.
I decided to focus on something simple and fundamental:
How do we validate that a migration is correct in terms of schema state?
My reasoning
A valid migration should:
apply cleanly;


be reversible (a downgrade should work);


be idempotent (you can apply/rollback it as many times as needed);


and most importantly ‚Äî after a full up + down, the schema should match the original, semantically.



That led me to build a CLI tool that tests your migrations for schema correctness.
You can read more about the methodology in the project‚Äôs repository.
So I‚Äôd really appreciate your help: bug reports, issues, PRs ‚Äî all welcome.
üëâ Seqwall on GitHub: https://github.com/realkarych/seqwall
articles.title: Time to test our migrations! ‚Äî Seqwall

articles.author: axtk
articles.description:
Tracking an asynchronous action's pending state is a very common task in the process of building UIs. Most UIs will show a loading indicator while async data fetching is in progress and an error message if the async action fails, e.g. due to a network error.
The question is: Can async action handling feel like setting up lightweight scaffolding without breaking into the code of the successful scenario? Similarly to JS error handling with try...catch...finally that can be easily added to the code of a successful case at any stage of the application development without major changes.
Most ways to handle an async action's state are wired into complex libs either for data fetching (like Tanstack React Query, RTK Query) or shared state management (like Redux Toolkit). Introducing such libs and adapting the code to them (and to some arguably clumsy patterns at times [1+2, 3]) require sizable rewrites and don't quite feel like adding lightweight scaffolding to the existing code.
In order to address my question, I ended up creating a small package called transient-state. It helps track async actions' state without breaking into the async actions' code and the app's shared state (or even requiring one). The async action's state can be used either locally or shared between multiple components equally easily. The package description outlines these and some other options in more detail.
articles.title: Unobtrusive async action state tracking in React

articles.author: Hidetaka Okamoto
articles.description:
Model Context Protocol (MCP) is gaining attention as a protocol that standardizes interactions with AI models. In this article, we'll explain a practical method for building a paid MCP server by combining Cloudflare Workers and Stripe.
MCP is a protocol that provides tools to AI models and enables the models to use them. By building a server that implements this protocol, you can provide APIs that can be used by various AI models.
This project combines the following components:
Cloudflare Workers runs the MCP server in a serverless environment. Stripe handles billing for paid features, and we've also implemented user authentication via GitHub OAuth. Additionally, we utilize the WordPress.org API as a data source.
The MCP server instantiates the McpServer class and defines tools in the init‚Ä¶
articles.title: Building a Paid MCP Server with Cloudflare Workers and Stripe

articles.author: Cristian Sifuentes
articles.description:
C# 14 introduces a powerful enhancement to the concept of extension methods: extension members. This feature allows you to extend not just instance methods, but also properties, indexers, and even static members of a type ‚Äî with cleaner, more expressive syntax.
In this post, we‚Äôll explore:
What extension members are
How to declare and use them
The difference between instance and static extension members
A real-world example
When and why to use them
Before C# 14, we could only extend types with methods using static classes:
public static class StringExtensions
{
    public static bool IsNullOrWhiteSpace(this string str)
        => string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(str);
}

Useful? Yes. But limiting ‚Äî no properties, no indexers, no static-style access. C# 14 changes that with a new syntax: extension‚Ä¶
articles.title: Mastering Extension Members in C# 14 ‚Äî Beyond Extension Methods

‚ÄúIn total, the 24 accounts bought up 16.7mn of the 200mn total $MELANIA tokens scheduled for sale during the launch period,‚Äù the Financial Times reported. ‚Äú[...] the run of sales that started pre-launch continued. About $900,000 worth of tokens bought by an additional 22‚Ä¶

articles.description:
Key Takeaways:

The Fed may pause rates but inject liquidity. Crypto could rally as a recession hedge.

The weak US dollar and gold rally signal a shift to scarce assets.

The US Federal Reserve Open Market Committee (FOMC) interest rate decision on May 7 will be a defining moment for risk-on assets, including cryptocurrencies. While the consensus points to no change in interest rates, Bitcoin (BTC) and altcoins could see gains if the US Treasury is compelled to inject liquidity to stave off an economic recession.
A more accommodative monetary policy could stimulate activity, but the Federal Reserve (Fed) is also contending with a weakening US dollar. Some analysts argue that a US interest rate cut may fail to stimulate growth as recession risks persist, potentially creating an ideal envir‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin could rally regardless of what the Federal Reserve FOMC decides this week: Here‚Äôs why

The ETP is listed on Euronext‚Äôs Paris and Amsterdam exchanges, 21Shares said in a May 6 announcement.¬†
Cronos (CRO) is a layer-1 blockchain network affiliated with Crypto.com, a centralized exchange.¬†
The chain is designed to integrate with the Ethereum and Cosmos ecosystems and support ‚Äúdecentralised finance (DeFi), NFTs, and Web3 applications,‚Äù 21Shares said.¬†
The ETP aims to provide investors with a ‚Äústraightforward way to integrate CRO into their portfolios through traditional banks and brokers, eliminating the need to directly handle digital wallets or exchanges,‚Äù 21Shares said.¬†
The CRO token‚Äôs historical performance. Source: CoinM‚Ä¶

New Hampshire became the first US state to allow its government to invest in crypto currencies including Bitcoin (BTC), after Governor Kelly Ayotte signed a bill passed by the legislature into law. 
In a May 6 notice, Ayotte announced on social media that New Hampshire would be permitted to ‚Äúinvest in cryptocurrency and precious metals‚Äù through a bill passed in the state Senate and House of Representatives. House Bill 302, introduced in New Hampshire in January, will allow the state‚Äôs treasury to use funds to invest in cryptocurrencies with a market capitalization of more than $500 billion, eliminating many tokens and memecoins.
‚ÄúThe Live Free or Die state is leading the way in forging the future of commerce and digital assets,‚Äù said New Hampshire Republicans in a May 6 X post.

Despite the recent decline in network activity, bullish macro indicators like the Macro Chain Index (MCI) suggest Bitcoin could soon rally above $100,000.

On May 5, the Bitcoin Risk-Off signal, an indicator that uses onchain and exchange data to assess correction risk, dropped to its lowest level (23.7) for the first time since March 27, 2019, when Bitcoin (BTC) traded at $4,000. The signal is currently in the blue zone, which historically suggests low correction risk and a high probability of a bullish trend. When the oscillator rises above 60 or turns red, it implies a high risk of bearish movement.¬†

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Bradley Peak
articles.description:
TL;DR:
Not sure if you‚Äôre in a bull or bear market? This guide breaks down how to spot the difference using price action, volume, sentiment and onchain data. Learn how to recognize market cycles, what signals to watch for and how to adjust your strategy for each phase so you can trade smarter.
Crypto markets can feel like emotional rollercoasters, prices soaring one month, then crashing the next. You're not alone if you‚Äôve ever wondered whether you are in a bull or a bear market.
In the simplest terms:

A bull market is when prices keep going up, people are excited and there‚Äôs a general sense that the future is bright. Think back to late 2020 and early 2021; Bitcoin (BTC) climbed from around $10,000 to nearly $70,000. New projects were launching daily and it felt like everyone from your co‚Ä¶
articles.title: Is it a bull or bear market? How to tell the difference

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Yohan Yun
articles.description:
For months, Cointelegraph took part in an investigation centered around a suspected North Korean operative that uncovered a cluster of threat actors attempting to score freelancing gigs in the cryptocurrency industry.
The investigation was led by Heiner Garcia, a cyber threat intelligence expert at Telef√≥nica and a blockchain security researcher. Garcia uncovered how North Korean operatives secured freelance work online even without using a VPN.
Garcia‚Äôs analysis linked the applicant to a network of GitHub accounts and fake Japanese identities believed to be associated with North Korean operations. In February, Garcia invited Cointelegraph to take part in a dummy job interview he had set up with a suspected Democratic People‚Äôs Republic of Korea (DPRK) operative who called himself ‚ÄúMotoki.‚Äù‚Ä¶
articles.title: North Korean spy slips up, reveals ties in fake job interview

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Barna Kiss
articles.description:
Opinion by: Barna Kiss, CEO of Malda
An idea recently floated by some prominent thinkers in the Ethereum space to reclaim value for the mainnet is the taxing of its Layer-2s. The future of Ethereum does not depend on policy but on enabling frictionless capital movement between the L2s in question. Tariffing rollups may appear a neat way to reclaim value for the mainnet. In practice, it would fragment the ecosystem, drain liquidity, push users toward centralized platforms, and avoid decentralized finance altogether. In a permissionless system, capital flows to where it is treated best, and Ethereum's rollups mistreat it.

Liquidity fragmentation is Ethereum's real threat
In traditional finance, the link between fluidity and growth is well established. Lower barriers to capital inflows lead ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Frictionless flows are Ethereum's path to economic dominance

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Bradley Peak
articles.description:
Why finance veterans are still skeptical about blockchain            
            
                
Blockchain has been part of the finance conversation for over a decade now. Yet many professionals remain cautious.¬†
Many seasoned professionals in finance, wealth management and economics often question blockchain‚Äôs relevance, asking, How exactly is blockchain supposed to fit into what we already do?

This question reflects a few key ongoing skepticisms about blockchain within finance.
Uncertainty about practical applications
Blockchain offers some big promises: faster settlements, stronger security and better transparency. But actually applying those promises across banking, accounting and operations is still complicated.
A 2021 APQC survey identified the main hurdles: a lack of industry-w‚Ä¶
articles.title: What bankers, CPAs and CFOs need to know about blockchain

articles.description:
US Representative Maxine Waters, ranking member of the House Financial Services Committee (HFSC), led some Democratic lawmakers out of a joint hearing on digital assets in response to what she called ‚Äúthe corruption of the President of the United States‚Äù concerning cryptocurrencies.
In a May 6 joint hearing of the HFSC and House Committee on Agriculture, Waters remained standing while addressing Republican leadership, saying she intended to block proceedings due to US President Donald Trump‚Äôs ‚Äúownership of crypto‚Äù and oversight of government agencies. Digital asset subcommittee Chair Bryan Steil, seemingly taking advantage of a loophole in committee rules, said Republican lawmakers would continue with the event as a ‚Äúroundtable‚Äù rather than a hearing.
HFSC Chair French Hill urged lawmakers‚Ä¶
articles.title: Dem lawmakers object to hearing, citing 'Trump‚Äôs crypto corruption'

articles.description:
Democratic lawmakers in Washington are backing off support for crypto legislation amid heightened concerns over corruption, including the conduct of the Trump family‚Äôs World Liberty Financial (WLFI).
In March, the GENIUS Act, which would regulate stablecoins in the US, passed a critical committee reading with the support of several pro-crypto Democrats. Democratic Senators Ruben Gallego, Mark Warner, Lisa Blunt Rochester, Andy Kim and Angela Alsobrooks voted with Republicans, opposite lead Democrat and prominent crypto critic Senator Elizabeth Warren.
The bill passed the committee only after a number of changes were made, including stricter requirements for stablecoin issuers and provisions for Anti-Money Laundering, countering terrorism financing and risk management procedures.¬†

Cointelegraph reported early signs ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin price forms two BTC futures gaps after Coinbase premium flips negative

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ezra Reguerra
articles.description:
While blockchain infrastructure may be ready for institutional use, many legal teams at big firms remain cautious about fully integrating the technology.¬†
At the Token2049 event in Dubai, DoubleZero founder and former Solana head of strategy Austin Federa told Cointelegraph that today‚Äôs high-performance blockchains like Solana are technically capable of supporting large-scale institutional usage. However, lawyers need to catch up.¬†
‚ÄúMost blockchains nowadays, especially things like Solana, are fast enough for institutions to use them,‚Äù Federa said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs really more about the institutions and the institution‚Äôs lawyers getting comfortable with crypto.‚Äù
Federa added that institutional lawyers and compliance teams are still addressing regulatory concerns. The executive said this may slow adop‚Ä¶
articles.title: Blockchains ready for institutions, lawyers hesitate: DoubleZero CEO

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
Investment bank¬†Citi¬†and Switzerland‚Äôs SIX Digital Exchange (SDX) are teaming up to modernize traditional private markets through tokenization.
The initiative, revealed during the Point Zero Forum in Switzerland, will leverage SDX‚Äôs blockchain-based Central Securities Depositary (CSD) platform to tokenize, settle and safekeep assets, according to a May 6 announcement.
The platform, expected to go live by the third quarter of 2025, will make late-stage, pre-initial public offering (IPO) equities accessible to institutional and eligible investors globally.
The project offers issuers a compliant and scalable framework to manage liquidity, particularly for early investors and employees, while maintaining cap table control. For investors, it opens access to high-growth, venture-backed companies‚Ä¶
articles.title: Citi and SDX partner to tokenize traditional private markets

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Adrian Zmudzinski
articles.description:
Decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) HydraDAO claims that its researchers were able to use a novel technique to repair severed spines in rats.
In a May 5 X post, decentralized science (DeSci) project HydraDAO said that one of its research projects resulted in ‚Äúrats who had their spines fully transected‚Äù being able to walk again. More notably, recovery from surgery reportedly only took five days.
Source: HydraDAO
The post featured a video of partially shaved (presumably due to surgery) rats walking in what appeared to be a laboratory setting. The effort in question is the Dowell spinal fusogens project led by Michael Lebenstein-Gumovski, which raised 380,700 USDC (USDC) from donors. The dedicated HydraDAO page reads:
‚ÄúThe Dowell team submitted a project proposal to HydraDAO. After ca‚Ä¶
articles.title: Research DAO claims paralyzed rats recover after spinal cord fix

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Yashu Gola
articles.description:
Key takeaways:

Berkshire holds $347B in cash, enough to buy ~18% of Bitcoin‚Äôs supply.

Greg Abel has not signaled a shift from Warren Buffett‚Äôs anti-Bitcoin stance.

Berkshire already has indirect crypto exposure via Nu Holdings, Jefferies.

Warren Buffett announced at Berkshire Hathaway's annual shareholder meeting on May 3 that he will step down as CEO by the end of 2025, with Greg Abel taking over. This transition raises speculation about Berkshire‚Äôs financial capacity to purchase Bitcoin (BTC) under the new leadership.
Source: Discover Crypto
Berkshire can easily surpass Strategy‚Äôs BTC stash 
Berkshire ended Q4 2024 with a record $347 billion in cash and US Treasury bills, representing about 32% of its $1.1 trillion market capitalization. 
The company could acquire approximately 3.52 ‚Ä¶
articles.title: How much Bitcoin can Berkshire Hathaway buy?

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Shailey Singh
articles.description:
What is the Paws Telegram Mini App?            
            
                
Paws is a Telegram-based Mini App created by the same team behind other projects, such as Notcoin and Dogs.¬†
If you‚Äôve been cruising around Telegram lately, chances are you‚Äôve stumbled upon Paws, the viral crypto Mini App that‚Äôs got everyone tapping, clicking and inviting their friends like it‚Äôs 2010 FarmVille all over again.¬†
Originally launched in October 2024 on The Open Network (TON) blockchain, Paws exploded in popularity with its ultra-simple tap-to-earn concept. Think of it as a gamified rewards engine embedded directly in Telegram, where users rack up points by completing tasks, referring others and interacting with mini-game elements.¬†
Within just eight days of going live, Paws pulled in over 20 million ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Is the Paws Telegram mini app legit? What you need to know

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ezra Reguerra
articles.description:
Petr Kozyakov, CEO of crypto payments platform Mercuryo, told Cointelegraph that the future of finance may not be a winner-takes-all scenario but a blend of digital assets and fiat, each used where it makes the most sense.¬†
In a Cointelegraph interview, Kozyakov said that while crypto payments are seeing an increase in adoption and demand, the asset class won‚Äôt be fully replacing fiat money anytime soon. He said the two asset classes will coexist, with people choosing the more convenient payment option in different situations.¬†
‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt think crypto will replace fiat,‚Äù Kozyakov told Cointelegraph. ‚ÄúThey will coexist, and people will turn to crypto when it‚Äôs the easier, more practical option, whether that‚Äôs for payroll, yield or money transfers.‚Äù
Mercuryo Petr Kozyakov at the Token2049 eve‚Ä¶
articles.title: Crypto spending will grow, but fiat isn‚Äôt going anywhere: Mercuryo CEO

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
Veteran US Internal Revenue Service (IRS) official Trish Turner was appointed to lead the agency‚Äôs digital assets division following the departure of two key crypto-focused executives.
Turner, who has spent over 20 years at the IRS and most recently served as a senior adviser within the Digital Assets Office, will now head the unit, according to a report from Bloomberg Tax citing a person familiar with the situation.
Her promotion marks a significant leadership transition at a time when US crypto tax enforcement is facing both internal and external pressures.
On May 5, Sulolit ‚ÄúRaj‚Äù Mukherjee and Seth Wilks, two private-sector experts brought in to lead the IRS‚Äôs crypto unit, exited after roughly a year in their roles.
Mukherjee served as compliance and implementation executive director, w‚Ä¶
articles.title: IRS appoints Trish Turner to head crypto division amid resignations

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ezra Reguerra
articles.description:
The CEO of crypto exchange OKX‚Äôs Middle East and North Africa (MENA) division has called on the industry to prioritize real-world utility as interest in tokenizing real-world assets (RWAs) continues to grow.
In a Cointelegraph interview at the Token20249 event in Dubai, OKX MENA CEO Rifad Mahasneh warned that while tokenization is promising, projects must ‚Äúclearly demonstrate‚Äù the benefits of tokenizing specific assets.¬†
‚ÄúIn some cases, we‚Äôre tokenizing things that don‚Äôt need tokenization, but in some cases, we‚Äôre tokenizing things that actually give you real, everyday value, right? And if you can see that everyday value, then that is a promising project,‚Äù Mahasneh told Cointelegraph.
He said hype can drive project growth in the Web3 space, but providing everyday value should be the priori‚Ä¶
articles.title: OKX exec warns against hype amid real-world asset tokenization boom

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Simon Cain
articles.description:
Opinion by: Simon Cain, contributor at Bitcoin Policy UK
Most jurisdictions globally are researching, developing or implementing retail central bank digital currencies (CBDCs). If you see these as harmless move-with-the-times digital updates of old-fashioned paper money, look again. CBDCs potentially mean financial serfdom via a monetary panopticon where the authorities closely control every transaction.¬†
If you think this sounds paranoid, just consider the words of Augustin Carstens, head of the Bank for International Settlements ‚Äî the central bank for the world‚Äôs central banks. Lamenting the authorities‚Äô current inability to control cash transactions, he says that with a CBDC, a ‚Äúcentral bank will have absolute control on the rules and regulations that will determine use... also we will ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin vs. digital fiat is freedom vs. serfdom

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
Efforts to pass crypto legislation in the US Senate face mounting resistance amid growing ethical concerns around US President Donald Trump‚Äôs ties to crypto.
In a May 5 letter to the Office of Government Ethics, Senators Elizabeth Warren and Jeff Merkley said that Trump and his family stand to personally profit from an investment involving UAE state-backed firm MGX, crypto exchange Binance and World Liberty Financial (WLFI).
The senators called for an urgent probe, warning the deal may violate the US Constitution‚Äôs Emoluments Clause and federal bribery statutes.
At the center of the controversy is WLFI‚Äôs USD1 stablecoin, reportedly chosen for a $2 billion investment MGX plans to make into Binance.
The senators said the transaction amounts to a potential backdoor for foreign influence and s‚Ä¶
articles.title: US Senate crypto bills stall amid Trump ties and ethics concerns
